name: Bauer Palladio Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Bauer Palladio about a year ago and absolutely loved it. We had a very rainy weekend in Venice and having such a lovely hotel to come back to made all the difference.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were charming, especially in the the bar/restaurant, and the hotel itself was beautifully renovated, We were upgraded to a suite with an enormous terrace which was really special - even in the rain! The quiet location on Giudecca (pretty much next door to the Cipriani) really suited us and it was really easy to get around: not just using the hotel shuttle, but also using the water buses.
reviews.title: Refined Class
What a wonderful stay
reviews.text: We're very fussy about our hotels but this one is very highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This unpretentious hotel delivered on all levels for us. The price we paid was great for the refined grandeur of the Palladio. I'm a flight attendant and i stay in many 4* hotels and i can certainly see the difference between them and this 5*. Anything we asked for was provided without fuss and the hotel really had a feeling of exclusivity about it (2 doors down from Elton John). We didn't use the restuarant, spa or bar as we were only on a short break and wanted to get into VCE and the lagoon. The breakfast was european in style and the staff attentive. The reception manager and the housekeeping staff were exceptional. The room we had was spotless and spacious. Must less stuffy than the sister hotels over the water in which we felt somewhat uncomfortable. We had a great stay and the private boat shuttle was a bonus.
reviews.title: A delightful oasis of calm in Venice

likes.liked: — beautiful building, peaceful location, great views
likes.disliked: — bedroom could have done with extra lights. Lounge areas need more furniture/tables for drinks etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used public transport as taxis were pricey and we bought a 'Rolling Venice Card' available to under 29's. This saved us packets on entrance fees and on the 72hr public transport ticket. Just present your passport at the tourist info desk in the airport. The best 4 euro i've ever spent.
reviews.title: Outstanding
ADEQUATE BUT I WOULD NOT BOOK AGAIN
reviews.text: I've just returned from a weekend at the Bauer Palladio (be aware this is NOT the same as the Bauer Palazzo which is across the Grand Canal) with my wife for a friend's wedding.

We stayed at the Cipriani on our last trip but this was full, and they recommended the adjacent Palladio on the Giudecca island. Before arrival I called to book the spa and it took over a minute for the hotel to answer.
reviews.title: Surprising Bauer Palladio

reviews.text: When we got there, the hotel was not what we expected. It's a converted convent which until last year was a conference centre. The entrance is anonymous, a small door next to the church. If it's glitz you're after, this hotel is not for you. The decor is a little austere, unlike, say, other converted religious buildings like the Villa San Michele, and there are still touches of conference centre if you look closely: the modern fire doors and fabric covering the walls of the lifts to hide the stainless steel beneath. The service, however, was great from the moment we arrived.
reviews.title: Really beautiful hotel but dreadful service
This is not a 5 star Hotel ...
reviews.text: We had booked a suite with canal view at Eu.650 +10%. We were shown to a suite with a garden view, and then to a smaller one with a tiny window overlooking the canal, so accepted the first which was huge and comfortable.

description: Palladio Hotel & SPA is an amazing building designed in the 16th century by the world-renowned Renaissance architect Andrea Palladio. The property is a rare jewel in Venice, with its 58 elegant guest rooms and 21 spacious Suites and Junior Suites, a private garden and breathtaking lagoon views. It is located on the Giudecca Island just across the basin from the word-famous sister properties Bauer Hotel and Bauer Il Palazzo. BAUER.Palladio Hotel & Spa has a warm and welcoming decor with a soft color palette of pastels. Each of its spacious rooms is beautifully detailed with the finest paint decoration and tapestries, while still maintaining its original identity.
